column2: aceaten, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While camping along a remote stretch of the coast in California, I contracted a pretty bad case of poison oak on my right leg. The Zanfel took away the itching and began reducing the impacted area on the first application. It came back the second and third days but I just reapplied and it went away again. Only side effect is that part of my leg still had a numbing feeling 2 montsh later. The stuff saved me!

column2: Chuck, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First, I don't work for the company. The only reason why I'm posting is because I saw all the negative comments. I got poison ivy 4 days ago and my breakout looks pretty bad. Its just on my forearms though. I just applied the product exactly how they said, and did scrub for the full 3 minutes. Its been 1 hour and the itching is 95% gone and its looking 95% better already. I'm very impressed and the money for it was well worth it to me.

column2: @bill teague, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i got poison ivy and heard about this product and went to get some and seen the price which was outrageous for a little tube of stuff that DOES NOT WORK!!!! the people that write the good reviews must work for this company because this was the worst money ive ever spent

column2: Itchy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had rash from poison oak, ivy, or sumac. Zanfel was gritty and difficult to work into a paste. Itching stopped while applying the paste but returned as soon as I washed the grit away. Definitely not worth the money or time. Anti itch creme and Benadryl worked much better.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Thought this was going to be miracle drug based on testimonials and exorbitant price, but was totally disappointed.  It feels good initially because of th grit in the wash - it doesn't take a dermatologist to figure out that rubbing sandpaper on poison ivy is going to feel good.  After that, I saw and felt no improvement and in fact, things continued to get worse.  My doctor said that essentially, no over-the-counter products are effective, you just have to wait out the rash or get on steroids.

column2: Santa g , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After suffering with poison ivy or poison what ever It was spreading did everything I knew to do but was still itching and miserable! My husband went to CVS the lady there told him about Zanfel it was expensive and I did really think it would work but he insisted I try it , oh it was wonderful the iching stopped I sleep like a baby that night next morning the rash wash going away no iching or burning I was shocked best money I ever spent !!!

I've used this stuff many times on legs and arms, does very good, sometimes do twice. I got bad ivy on face, under chin, cheeks, one eye-lid and upper lip, I did it and it burned my cheeks bad, dried up good under chin, still red and sore on cheeks, very itchey, no blisters, just raw.

column2: bosslady, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My family was roasting hot dogs over an open fire at night and I sat indian style in what must have been a patch of poison oak. Severe irratation/ itching from waist down. Bought this very expensive creme out of despiration.Very difficult to work into paste, itching continues for almost 1hr then returns in about 3hrs. Tube does not go far and relief was minimal.  Never again! Benedryl just as good.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This product did not live up to its hype.It did not work in 30 seconds, more like 30 minutes, and lasted about 3 to 5 hours.I tried 3 applications as the itching returned then stopped due to irritation.  I found it was about as effective as Calomine Lotion.

column2: petia, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Poison ivy rush.It does not help, an expansive, not ingredients from what it made,( I think it is backing soda), not affect, had to see doctor.

column2: subnoize soja, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After ride in the woods I had to pee not realizing I had brushed up against poison oak. Needless to say the location of my irritation was not pleasent. The it h was almost unbearable...and I found myself pouring extremely hot water over my privates many times a day (yes this does temporarily provide a relief to the itching) but I needed more. I came across Zanfeldecided to buy an overpriced box of this stuff. After getting home and opening the box I felt ripped off....this tube was so small. Then I tried. This stuff was amazing! After taking a shower n using it on my genital area the itchy was completely gone and the product has a grit to it which allowed me scratch myself during application (heavenly)  within an hour after my shower I could see my sores dried up considerably and all were dried by the next morning with no itching returning.

column9: I have used a whole tube  and still itch

column2: Bpkr103, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had severe poison ivy and used this paste 2 times. It stopped the itching and speading immediately ( thank goodness ) Dried out all areas real good ! I would definitely use it again. Need to ask pharmicist for it as it is NOT on the counter.
